page.title: 02Attitudes
page.content: Everyone living in the area has a positive attitude to conservation and is keen to preserve the natural habitats of plants and animals, believing this can be done alongside farming. They are tolerant of visitors using footpaths across their land even when this leads to accidental trespass, and are resigned to a limited amount of poaching provided no damage is done to stock. As hill farmers, they receive subsidies from the E.E.C., but are very anti French farmers. They are critical of a new government scheme which pays for them to employ a part-time secretary to deal with VAT and other farm business. This is a compulsory order emanating from the E.E.C. which they feel is unnecessary and wasteful, and they would prefer to deal with all their business on their own.
